00020 /// @file TmpFileFactory.h
00021 /// @brief for usage examples, look at "util/test-tmpfilefactory.cpp"
00022 
00023 #ifndef _TMPFILEFACTORY_H_
00024 #define _TMPFILEFACTORY_H_
00025 //
00026 #include <cstring>
00027 #include <string>
00028 #include <vector>
00029 //
00030 
00031 /// @brief     Allocate temporary filenames and arrange to remove them when done.
00032 class TmpFileFactory {
00033 public:
00034   /// filenames we have allocated
00035   std::vector<std::string> m_tmpfilenames;
00036   /// directory names we have allocated
00037   std::vector<std::string> m_tmpdirnames;
00038   /// the directory in which the files will be allocated within.
00039   std::string m_tmpdir;
00040   /// the default prefix for the file and dir names.
00041   std::string m_prefix;
00042   /// the default suffix for the file names.
00043   std::string m_suffix;
00044   /// Controls the behavior to help debugging.
00045   int m_opt_debug;
00046   /// When set produces extra output for debugging.
00047   int m_opt_verbose;
00048   ///
00049   static int m_fileCount;
00050   int m_maxTrialCnt;
00051 
00052   /// @brief     The default constructor.
00053   TmpFileFactory();
00054 
00055   /// @brief     The destructor
00056   virtual ~TmpFileFactory();
00057 
00058   /// @brief     Remove all the files and directories we have generated.
00059   ///            Called from ~TmpFileFactory()
00060   void cleanUp();
00061 
00062   /// @brief     Return the next value of the file counter.
00063   /// @return    the next value.
00064   static int incFileCounter();
00065 
00066   /// @brief     Sets the directory in which the tmp files will be allocated.
00067   /// @param     dirname   
00068   void setTmpdir(const std::string& tmpdir);
00069 
00070   /// @brief     Generate and create a directory for tmp files.
00071   /// @return    The directory path
00072   std::string makeTmpDir();
00073   
00074   /// @brief     Set the default prefix for tmp names.
00075   /// @param     prefix    The prefix to use.
00076   void setPrefix(const std::string& prefix);
00077   /// @brief     Sets the default suffix (".tmp") for name from
00078   /// @param     suffix    
00079   void setSuffix(const std::string& suffix);
00080 
00081   /// @brief     Generates a string which is unique for this run of the program.
00082   /// @return    A 'unique' string.
00083   std::string genUniqueString();
00084 
00085   /// @brief     Generate a name which does not exist in the filesystem.
00086   ///            Does NOT remember to delete the filename later.
00087   /// @param     prefix    prefix for the unique string.
00088   /// @param     suffix    suffix for the unique string.
00089   /// @return    the unique pathname (dir+prefix+unique+suffix)
00090   std::string genFilename_basic(const std::string& prefix,const std::string& suffix);
00091 
00092   /// @brief     Generates a unique filename with user supplied prefix and suffix.
00093   ///            Remembers to delete it later.
00094   /// @param     prefix    user override to prefix
00095   /// @param     suffix    user override to suffix
00096   /// @return    a unique pathname
00097   std::string genFilename(const std::string& prefix,const std::string& suffix);
00098 
00099   /// @brief     Generates a unique filename with the default prefix and suffix.
00100   ///            Remembers to delete it later.
00101   /// @return    a unique file name.
00102   std::string genFilename();
00103 
00104   /// @brief     generate a vector of filenames in one call.
00105   /// @param     cnt       The number of filenames to generate.
00106   /// @return    the vec of filenames.
00107   std::vector<std::string> genFilenames(int cnt);
00108 
00109   /// @brief    Generates and creates a unique directory
00110   /// @return   the pathname to the directory.
00111   std::string genDirname();
00112 
00113   /// @brief     Remeber this filename to delete later.
00114   /// @param     filename   What to remove when "cleanUp()" is called.
00115   void rememberToRemove(const std::string& filename);
00116 
00117   /// @brief     Remeber this dirname to delete later.
00118   /// @param     filename   What to remove when "cleanUp()" is called.
00119   void rememberToRemoveDir(const std::string& dirname);
00120 
00121   /// @brief     Sets the debugging options
00122   ///            0=None
00123   ///            1=Dont remove the tmp files, leave them for debugging.
00124   /// @param     level     
00125   void setDebug(int level);
00126   /// @brief     Sets the verbose level
00127   ///            0=No output
00128   ///            1 or more = logs more actions.
00129   /// @param     level     
00130   void setVerbose(int level);
00131 
00132   /// @brief     Get The suggested tmp directory for this system.
00133   /// @return    The suggested path name.
00134   std::string getSystemTmpDir();
00135 
00136 };
00137 
00138 // These two functions provide access to a global TmpFileFactory
00139 // Which can be used by everyone. Do remember to call
00140 // GlobalTmpFileFactoryFree as you exit main
00141 // to make sure it cleans up for you.
00142 
00143 /// @brief     Returns a pointer to the global tmpfilefactory.
00144 ///            Allocates it if needed.
00145 /// @return    The global tmpfilefactory
00146 TmpFileFactory* GlobalTmpFileFactory();
00147 
00148 /// @brief     Frees the global tmpfilefactory.
00149 void GlobalTmpFileFactoryFree();
00150 
00151 #endif /* _TMPFILEFACTORY_H_ */
